place.name: COMBE
place.gazetteerText: COMBE, a parish in the district of Hungerford and County of Hants; at the boundary with Berks and Wilts, 6 miles SSE of Hungerford r. station, and 10½ N of Andover. It includes the hamlet of Eastwick; and has a post office under Hungerford. Acres, 2, 226. Real property, £1, 786. Pop., 225. Houses, 45. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Winchester. Value, £107.* Patrons, the Dean and Chapter of Windsor. The church is a very small ancient building, with a small wooden tower. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
